alert.note: Alert for Conecuh; Escambia; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Monroe, northwestern Escambia and southwestern Conecuh Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 600 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Uriah, or 10 miles southwest of Frisco City, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Uriah and I65 And AL 113. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
